sections.effect: This section lists amendments to the Health Insurance Act made on specific dates.
sections.notes: This section primarily serves as a record of amendments and does not establish specific requirements or conditions.

“schedule of laboratory benefits” means the document published by the Ministry of Health titled “Schedule of Benefits for Laboratory Services”, dated February 14, 2025 (effective as of March 3, 2025), which is available on a website of the Government of Ontario;
“schedule of optometry benefits” means the document published by the Ministry of Health titled “Schedule of Benefits for Optometry Services (March 11, 2023 (effective September 1, 2023))”, but does not include the “[Commentary…]” portions of the document, or any appendix to the document;
“spouse” means a person,
 (a) to whom the person is married, or
 (b) with whom the person was living, in a conjugal relationship outside marriage, if the two persons,
 (i) have cohabited for at least one year,
 (ii) are together the parents of a child, or
 (iii) have together entered into a cohabitation agreement under section 53 of the Family Law Act;
“standard ward accommodation” means,
 (a) a bed in a hospital area designated by the hospital in accordance with Regulation 794 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990 under the Ministry of Health Act as a standard ward.
 (b) REVOKED: O. Reg. 375/93, s. 1.

 (2)  A reference to the schedule of benefits or the schedule of optometry benefits in relation to a service is a reference to the relevant schedule in force at the time the service was rendered. O. Reg. 320/04, s. 1 (3).
 (3)  A person who is exempted from the requirement to be a member of the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario under subsections 9 (1) and (3) of the Medicine Act, 1991 by a regulation made under that Act is a prescribed person for the purposes of the definition of “physician” in section 1 of the Act, except with respect to the application of sections 27, 28.2 and 29 of this Regulation. O. Reg. 208/23, s. 1 (4).
 (4)  REVOKED: O. Reg. 265/03, s. 1 (2).
sections.effect: Establishes amendments to the Health Insurance Act and defines terms related to benefits and exemptions.
sections.notes: Includes various amendments effective on specified dates and definitions for terms such as 'schedule of laboratory benefits' and 'schedule of optometry benefits'.

sections.title: or the purposes of subsection 11 (2
sections.raw_text:
1.1  For the purposes of subsection 11 (2.1) of the Act,
“dependant” means a dependent child who is, 
 (a) under 22 years of age, or
 (b) 22 years of age or older, but dependent on the member of the Canadian Forces due to a mental or physical disability;
“member of the Canadian forces” means,
 (a) a regular force member, or 
 (b) a member of the reserve force of the Canadian Forces referred to in subsection 15 (3) of the National Defence Act (Canada) who falls within the circumstances described in clause 50.2 (1) (a) or (b) of the Employment Standards Act, 2000;
“spouse” has the meaning set out in subsection 1 (1) of this Regulation. O. Reg. 133/09, s. 2.
sections.effect: Defines the terms 'dependant' and 'member of the Canadian Forces' for the purposes of subsection 11 (2.1) of the Act.
sections.notes: The definition of 'spouse' refers to subsection 1 (1) of this Regulation.
sections.validation_note: Missing presence requirements for eligibility section
